title: The Residents - The Third Reich N' Roll
description:
The Residents - The Third Reich N' Roll (1976)
44,1 khz Stereo 192kbps
Mpeg Layer 3 (MP3)
Total 56,1 MB

1. The Residents - Swastikas on Parade (17:45)
2. The Residents - Hitler was a Vegetarian (18:34)
3. The Residents - Satisfaction (4:32)


(sv)
60-talspop s&aring; som Residents minns den.
Trots all nazi-referenser s&aring; har skivan
ingenting med nazism att g&ouml;ra.
Vad Residents i sj&auml;lva verket vill s&auml;ga
med allt det h&auml;r &auml;r att musikindustrin
var lika fascistisk p&aring; 60-talet som den &auml;r idag.

Ett annat syfte med denna skiva kan vara att ta
ner musiken p&aring; jorden och satirisera &ouml;ver likheter
mellan att dyrka popstj&auml;rnor som gudar och blint f&ouml;lja
politiska ledare.

Som en bonus har jag sl&auml;ngt in en cover p&aring; Rolling Stones
gamla 60-talshit "Satisfaction", som finns med p&aring; vissa
nyutg&aring;vor av den h&auml;r skivan.


(eng)
60's pop as the Residents remember it.
Despite all the nazi imagery, this album
has nothing to do with nazism.
What the Residents are saying is simply that
the music industry were just as fascist in
the 60's as it is today.

Another possibly purpose of this album might be
to bring the music down to earth and to satirize
the similarities between worshipping popstars as
gods and to blindly follow political leaders.

As a bonus, I've included a cover of Rolling Stones'
old hit "Satisfaction", which appear on some reissues
of this album.
